programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell hopes that his instincts will put him back in profit, while Dave has trouble finding anything worth bidding for.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine a cavalry jacket from the American Civil War, and a book signed by vaudeville performer and silent-film star Will Rogers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a wanted poster of John Wilkes Booth, the actor who assassinated Abraham Lincoln.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team turns a petrol pump into a beer cooler and restore a sign from a 1970s fast food restaurant.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Singer Jason Mraz asks Rick to help him restore a sign as a tribute to his late grandfather.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of the Jamie Davis Heavy Rescue team that patrols the Coquihalla Highway on Canada's Cascade Mountains.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: Jennifer Brennan has to deliver crawfish to a restaurant before exposure to the summer sun spoils them, while Marc Springer battles his way through a hailstorm as he transports a trolley bus that is dangerously close to the height limit.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.sub-title: Not with a Whimper but a Bang
programme.desc: Jarrett Joyce gets the chance to transport the most valuable cargo of his career - but it will be worthless to him if he cannot move it across the country in four days. Chris Hanna and Robbie Welsh pick up a state-of-the-art nuclear bomb shelter.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Investigating the story of three women who were found murdered in different Iowa hotel rooms in the 1990s. Detectives found it difficult to bring the killer to justice with forensic evidence testing still in its infancy.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: An angry driver pulls out a gun after Sonja clamps his car.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Uncooperative party-goers give Dave a tough time on South Street.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes into detail about his plans for a new pawn store, and Ashley is caught in the crossfire when a fight breaks out in the middle of the floor.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: At the new shop, the Golds are surprised to find a bag of gems inside a former employee's desk.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are delighted when they visit a house packed with rare collectibles - but are less pleased by the prices the owner is asking for them.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Strange objects above Sweden, a UFO over Portugal and an extraordinary 'mass-sighting' of strange luminous phenomena in a remote Italian village.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Events involving military and intelligence agencies, with suggestions of cover-ups relating to two unexplained incidents in the east of England in 1956 and 1980

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team turns a petrol pump into a beer cooler and restore a sign from a 1970s fast food restaurant.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Singer Jason Mraz asks Rick to help him restore a sign as a tribute to his late grandfather.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over a First World War helmet and a holster from the TV series Gunsmoke, while Rick decides they need to get into shape.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team members get their hands on an 1863 rifle that proved decisive in the American Civil War, and examine a fully restored 1915 Ford Model T taxi.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders head to Torrance and compete over an unusual unit that may prove to be one of the most valuable in the series' history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: At auctions in Bellflower, Ivy prays he can salvage something from a bad purchase. Meanwhile, Jarrod buys a unit that proves a nightmare for Brandi..

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes into detail about his plans for a new pawn store, and Ashley is caught in the crossfire when a fight breaks out in the middle of the floor.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: At the new shop, the Golds are surprised to find a bag of gems inside a former employee's desk.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After being tasked with forging a weapon from cable steel, the best smiths must create an Egyptian Khopesh.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos investigates whether aliens lie at the heart of Earth's most famous mysteries. In this instalment, he looks at the new clues narrowing down the possible location of Atlantis, suggesting that Plato's mysterious island was the home of an advanced civilisation.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Stories of UFO sightings and alien abductions, beginning with reports of multiple bright aerial lights near Tinley Park, Illinois, in 2004.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds have a decision to make when a man wants to buy a pair of very expensive earrings on the condition that the store also does his piercing.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Former employee Tressa returns to sell the Rolex that got her sacked and Les struggles to control the situation when insults start to fly between her and Ashley.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy knows exactly what he wants at an auction in Fontana and has high hopes of getting it, while Jarrod and Brandi need to work on their tactics.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Thrill of a Kitty and the Agony of Smoked Meat
programme.desc: Darrell aims to prove that treasure sometimes looks like total trash, while Rene won't be content with second best.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North v South
programme.desc: Captain McLaughlin steams in, desperate to make up for last season. But when gunshots are heard, it becomes clear that the local crews are far from happy with the northern invasion.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: History threatens to repeat itself as Steve Grahame and convoy partner Sy Howells battle to reach a remote community before the wet season leaves them stranded..

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: Two men remain on the island as the storm of the year blows in. The weather, isolation and starvation prove too much for one contestant in the season finale.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Interior designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, actor Charles Dance (Game of Thrones) and comedienne and actress Andi Osho compete to have their pet hates banished to the infamous room. Frank Skinner hosts the light-hearted panel show.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the comedy panel show, which sees The Great British Bake Off presenter Sue Perkins, Strictly Come Dancing judge Bruno Tonioli and TV host Steve Jones compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include catalogues, flat-pack furniture and gym etiquette.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Comedians Rob Beckett and James Acaster, BBC Breakfast presenter Steph McGovern and historian Suzannah Lipscomb join host Sue Perkins and captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe on the comedy panel show. In this edition, the two sides answer questions about famous people past and present who share the name Charlie, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker - prompting comic banter, funny facts and unusual stats as the teams vie to outdo each other.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sara Pascoe, Larry Dean, Gary Delaney
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing routines by Larry Dean and Gary Delaney.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Omid Djalili, Alex Horne, Shaun Ryder and Kathy Burke join Alan Davies for funny stories, including how fulfilling a dying wish went wrong.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle take downhill mountain-bike racing to the next level by adding more wheels.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A group of angry locals trap an innocent man in a telephone box and accuse him of being a paedophile, and a woman claims her boyfriend is trying to kill her.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike takes an epic Route 66 road trip in an antique convertible to return it to the widow of its previous owner.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Dustin continues to pose a threat to Brandon and Lori in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The Alvarado brothers stumble across an interesting collectible, while Brandon and Lori bid on a storage facility for pets.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: When the guys visit a woman overwhelmed by an incredible inheritance, she opens the doors to a secret vault.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Pickers Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz make waves when they hit the road in a one-of-a-kind rocket car.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: The boys build a tour bus with a fold-out stage for a Labrador musician. With a limited budget, the boys build a vehicle that serves as transportation, lounge and performance space.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: The CRB crew builds a barge to help the flooded village of Mud Lake recover from disaster.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson drives the Jaguar F-Type sports car on some of Britain's finest roads, while Richard Hammond jumps inside the Range Rover Sport and gives it a thorough workout off-road, on a track and in what he believes is its most natural habitat - the lanes of Cheshire. James May goes for a countryside adventure in the New Routemaster London bus brought into use in 2013, which is propelled by a turbodiesel generator and a powerful electric motor. Inspired by the machines they have tested, the trio then meet to celebrate Britain's motor industry with a grand finale in front of Buckingham Palace. Plus, former Formula One driver Mark Webber takes to the track for a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Two males on bikes are spotted acting suspiciously near a cashpoint. One evades police and a pursuit ensues. A police dog undertakes its final shift.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: Collin and Corey are hired to transform a client's bruised up Crown Victoria Interceptor into a rough and ready rat rod, stripping it down to a rolling chassis.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: To attract tourists to North West River and make a friend's culinary dreams come true, the boys build a gourmet food boat complete with kitchen, barbecue and seating for six.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Mick Sweetmore's team tries to fix a radio issue in a bid to keep the new pursuit cars on the tail of Merseyside's criminals. There's a surprise visit from the fleet's oldest member, and the bosses get dirty hands when things go wrong on the road.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are each challenged to find a classic car at auction for Â£3,000. Exploring whether they are more fun to drive than modern alternatives, the trio then take the vehicles to Majorca to compete in a rally. Jeremy also test-drives the BMW Z4 and Nissan 370Z, and AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of a Reliant Robin to investigate the reasons behind the lack of three-wheeled cars on the market. The Stig takes the Bentley Continental Supersports for a spin around the test track, and James May fires up the Toyota Hilux for a final challenge - a gruelling drive up Eyjafjallajokull, an active Icelandic volcano that halted flights in British airspace in 2010

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Interior designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, actor Charles Dance (Game of Thrones) and comedienne and actress Andi Osho compete to have their pet hates banished to the infamous room. Frank Skinner hosts the light-hearted panel show.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the comedy panel show, which sees The Great British Bake Off presenter Sue Perkins, Strictly Come Dancing judge Bruno Tonioli and TV host Steve Jones compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include catalogues, flat-pack furniture and gym etiquette.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Historian Kate Williams and comedians Lucy Porter, Chris Addison and Al Porter join host Sue Perkins and captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe on the comedy panel show. In this edition, the two sides answer questions about famous people past and present who share the name Steve, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker - prompting comic banter, funny facts and unusual stats as the teams vie to outdo each other.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Nish Kumar, Luisa Omielan, David O'Doherty
programme.desc: Last week saw the return of the comedy show in which three comedians take the stage of the Hammersmith Apollo in west London. The premise is simple. One comic acts as host, warming up the audience before introducing short sets by two other stand-ups. Future editions promise the likes of Ed Byrne, Rob Beckett, Joel Dommett, Henning Wehn, Lucy Porter, but tonight Nish Kumar plays host, before handing over to David O'Doherty and Luisa Omielan.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies hosts more surreal celebrity challenges, as Lolly Adefope tries long distance painting, and Hugh Dennis is befuddled by an egg.

programme.title: Sliced
programme.desc: Joshua plucks up the courage to ask Naomi out, only to find she's already lined up another date. Ricky's plan to save the day backfires and Mario has a big date of his own to go on.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner welcomes Strictly Come Dancing head judge Len Goodman, actress and impressionist Ronni Ancona and quick-witted comic Tim Vine to discuss their pet hates, in the hope of having them banished to Room 101. Their gripes include cats in the garden, karaoke DJs, foreign food and small talk at parties.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: Documentary about the Holocaust and some of the key figures involved, beginning with Hjalmar Schacht, who was never a Nazi but played a vital role in Hitler's plans.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorset's Jurassic coast to explore the county's hidden Second World War story. Starting beside the defences on Chesil Beach, he heads east to finish in Swanage and Studland Bay. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey explains how writing a biography of his ancestor John, the first Duke of Marlborough, changed the way Winston Churchill was seen by the public and politicians, and so paved the way for his return to power. The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorset's Jurassic coast to explore the county's hidden Second World War story. Starting beside the defences on Chesil Beach, he heads east to finish in Swanage and Studland Bay. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The team investigates acres of overgrown gardens surrounding Upton Castle in Pembrokeshire, the centre of a romantic mystery for owners Steve and Pru Barlow. The pair bought what looked like a medieval castle at the front and a Victorian mansion at the back, leaving the origins of the complex unclear. The group digs trenches to look for a courtyard, while building specialists crawl through the roof and an excavation for the remains of a drawbridge takes place. Presented by Tony Robinson.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the archaeologists excavate a site in Leicestershire, which they believe contains an Anglo-Saxon burial ground. Though their initial search for a cemetery proves fruitless, more digging leads to the experts uncovering evidence of several types of funeral, as well as a highly valuable piece of jewellery - and one member of the team volunteers to take part in a re-creation of a cremation ceremony from the period.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The story of the Ahnenerbe research institute, which was set up to provide scientific backing to Hitler's ideology, through a series of horrific experiments.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Featuring a look at sightings of UFOs during the Second World War, a US plan to use bats against Japan's cities, and a German attempt to persuade British POWs to change sides.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the archaeologists excavate a site in Leicestershire, which they believe contains an Anglo-Saxon burial ground. Though their initial search for a cemetery proves fruitless, more digging leads to the experts uncovering evidence of several types of funeral, as well as a highly valuable piece of jewellery - and one member of the team volunteers to take part in a re-creation of a cremation ceremony from the period.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough explores animal oddities, looking at two different animals with curiously distinctive evolutionary quirks, linked together by a common theme. In this instalment, he examines how hedgehogs and rhinos have developed protective skins.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the vision in squid and owls, which have both developed incredible adaptations to help them navigate at night.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Featuring a look at sightings of UFOs during the Second World War, a US plan to use bats against Japan's cities, and a German attempt to persuade British POWs to change sides.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The story of the Ahnenerbe research institute, which was set up to provide scientific backing to Hitler's ideology, through a series of horrific experiments.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright is reluctant to buy a new suit until Nurse Gladys Emmanuel persuades him to. He agrees, but only if I can be made in the same style as his old one. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright expands his empire by opening a mobile shop in a bid to impress Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, but the enterprise is cut short by a close encounter with some perishables.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.sub-title: And Then I Fell in Love
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki sees a barefoot girl being knocked over by a car, marking the beginning of a case that takes the team into the harrowing world of sex grooming and teenage prostitution. The police know the girl has been abused and suspicion soon falls on her stepfather. Meanwhile, an early-morning bath saves Harry's life, and two puzzling corpses are brought in to the centre - a heavily tattooed man and a decomposed body found at the airport. Guest starring Sanjeev Bhaskar, Elyes Gabel and Madeline Duggan.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters decide to launch their new collection two weeks before that of a leading rival, causing unforeseen repercussions. Unable to agree on designs, Beatrice and Evie have a blazing row. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters are torn between a prestigious job offer in Paris and their fashion house, and Jack creates another dilemma by asking Beatrice to marry him. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet, Aden Gillett, Louise Lombard and Barbara Jefford.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Tiredness turns to exhaustion for Tilly as she fails to keep up with the heavy workload.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: New arrival Craig is desperate to prove his worth by handling a real blaze, and Mick clashes with Mooney over how Blue Watch should be run.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: As the inquiry into Recall's death takes place, Shauna's mood swings become more extreme and Adam fears Ross's presence in the pub has something to do with the DI Roebuck business.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Two new nurses struggle to make a good impression on their first day as one of them questions Mubbs's judgement, while the other gives her superiors cheek and stuns Diane by revealing she spent the night with Peter. Meanwhile, Jess grows closer to her patient Robert Pullman, causing Lisa and Ric to worry she has more than just a professional interest in him. Kath feels uncomfortable with Larry's spontaneity, but he is determined to win her round.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gabriel once again steps outside the bounds of the law, unleashing his gang of thugs on two youths who have been tormenting an elderly lady, but the unexpected return of an old ally could mean his days as a vigilante are numbered. Meanwhile, Sam turns to a police profiler for help in tracking down the Sun Hill serial rapist, Sheelagh finds herself accused of racism, and a race to save two children from drowning has a profound effect on Honey and Cameron.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Already haunted by Kerry's rape, Cameron is plunged into further emotional torment after failing to save the two drowning children. Sam's hunt for the Sun Hill rapist is jeopardised by a witness's suicide attempt and alarm bells ring for Ken when he spies the matriarch of a notorious criminal clan thought to have been in exile abroad. Guest starring Lynda Bellingham.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark feels he is being brushed off, while Ian gets told off by Pete. John pays Eddie a surprise visit, Michelle has her eye on promotion and Nick shows improvement.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Hattie is determined to keep her job with Ian, Eddie is overjoyed to see Eibhlin, Rachel has some explaining to do to Michelle, and people are unaware of Mark's situation.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: An unstable woman, whose baby died before being christened, steals a sick infant from the hospital, while a retiring detective constable confesses his partner caused an accident in which several lives were put at risk. Elsewhere, Charlie tells Baz he wishes to end their affair.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A property developer approaches Lady Jane's husband and offers him a business partnership, making Lovejoy suspicious. Starring Ian McShane, with guest appearances by Nicky Henson and Sherrie Hewson.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A hard-up major tries to raise cash by selling his memoirs - but Jim warns him about the dangers of strolling down memory lane. Ian Hendey guest stars in the detective drama, alongside John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: French Fields
programme.desc: William learns that getting fired in French sounds just the same as it does in English, but the Fields know they can always go back to England if the worst comes to the worst.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Bad-tempered Mr Grainger is deemed too long in the tooth to continue at Grace Brothers and calls are made for his resignation. Classic comedy, starring Arthur Brough and Mollie Sugden.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth plans an extravagant riverside picnic and invites all and sundry from the higher echelons of society, including the vicar and his wife. Alas for her dreams of social success, the event proves a wash-out. Patricia Routledge stars.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Lair of the Cat Creature
programme.desc: A hang-gliding enthusiast crashes down in the village, mistakenly believing that he's landed in France, thus breaking the long-distance record. The gang tries to compensate for his disappointment by making him the best at something else - identifying a strange cat creature lurking in the woods. Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy star.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: An old friend asks the detective to investigate the death of his father, which he is convinced should be treated as murder. Due to his suspension from the police force, Wallander refuses to get involved - but finds himself drawn back to the case when his acquaintance is also found dead. Drama, starring Kenneth Branagh and Tom Hiddleston, with Rupert Graves, Angela Thorne and Vincent Regan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Retired detective Steve McAndrew arrives from Glasgow to help reinvestigate one of his original cases when a missing girl's DNA is found at the scene of a petrol station robbery in Clapham, south London. It's clear that the inquiry is a very personal one for McAndrew, and although his personality rubs the team up the wrong way, his methods soon pay dividends. Denis Lawson stars.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki is furious with Leo when he re-examines a child abuse case by her former mentor, leading to conflict between the pathologists. But she soon has more to worry about when a workman at the centre reveals how his mother is being manipulated by a convicted serial killer into searching for his hidden teenage victims.

programme.title: The Level
programme.desc: As police comb the haulage yard for clues, Nancy must hide her guilt from both a fraught Hayley and her colleagues, but realises she has left incriminating evidence at the scene. Newman mounts a risky armed operation to ensnare both Elliot and the truck, although events spiral out of control when Nancy goes unprotected into the lion's den - with unexpected and bloody consequences.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson presents the show from Cheltenham racecourse, where finds include a royal serving dish, Tibetan bronze statues and a valuable lighter.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz in which players can accumulate big cash totals by answering super quick-fire easy money questions. However, in order to take home that cash, they must survive The Switch, a series of three super hard multiple-choice questions that each has only one incorrect choice. Hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Scottish Liberal Democrats.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Hour-long episode. Rhona struggles with a revelation, Bernice is overwhelmed by a gesture, and Jacob is hopeful about the future.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show: Live
programme.desc: A special Christmas-themed live edition of the financial advice show, offering tips on the best shopping deals to be found in the run-up to the holidays. Martin will also be answering viewers' questions on any economic issues. With Angellica Bell.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the survival challenge reality show which sees a group of famous faces living in the Australian jungle, struggling to complete the tough daily tasks. The campmates try to cope with everything the contest throws at them, but are the cracks beginning to show?.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: On Assignment
programme.desc: Rageh Omaar introduces more reports from around the world. Tom Clarke investigates why Donald Trump wanted to buy Greenland, Richard Pallot reports on the impact of tourism on locals in Amsterdam and the introduction of on-the-spot fines for inebriated visitors, and Nina Nannar visits a 'rage room' in Paris, where people can relieve their tension through destroying things.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined in the studio by comedian, author and Britain's Got Talent judge David Walliams and Edward Norton, who has recently directed his second movie, crime drama Motherless Brooklyn. Also dropping in are the stars of the new Charlie's Angels movie, Kristen Stewart, Naomi Scott and Ella Balinska, and Robbie Williams, who will be performing live.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: An exploration of how water is harnessed to power ships, the creation of decaffeinated coffee from beans, and the production of smoked fish.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a V8-powered Land Rover Defender for less than Â£5,000, that modifications expert Edd China can turn into a modern urban vehicle.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini auctions a 1956 Volkswagen Karmann Ghia with no reserve and a VW Dropside goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini finds a pair of stunning Chryslers on display in a former bank, and prepares a 1931 Imperial CG Roadster for auction.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage demonstrates what happens when a dog gets behind the wheel. Plus, rowdy races gone wrong, and an incredible dance-off on the highway.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Peculiar pedestrians take to the road, and reckless drivers throw caution in the wind. Plus, dash-cams continue to capture people behaving in inexplicable ways.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A collision on a racetrack results in a multi-car pile-up, houses are swept away by floodwaters, a man is sucked into a jet engine, and an F1 powerboat takes off.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A massive explosion occurs at a propane plant, a boat and its passengers are sucked under a ferry, a dragster disintegrates at 130mph, and a racing boat crashes.

programme.title: Heli-Loggers
programme.desc: As the Brittain River project comes to an end, Kurtis Brown takes on one of the biggest trees of his career and Cleaver tries to get home quickly to his pregnant wife.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and a team of mechanics restore a 1967 Camaro back to its former glory.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in creating next-generation race-cars that run on electricity. Plus, the creation of mead, favourite drink of the Vikings.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.sub-title: You'll Know My Name Is the Lord
programme.desc: The crews of the Northwestern, Seabrooke, Time Bandit, Wizard, Kodiak and Ramblin' Rose return to the perilous, icy waters of the Bering Sea.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Dirt Dogs Vern and Leon are forced to uproot their operation, Gold Gypsies Chris and Greg face a huge decision, and remote prospectors Henri and Kelli strike salt-lake gold.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Robbie's house-moving crew faces a difficult job transporting a large house in dangerous, wet conditions. And, Mark is on a deadline to transport mining gear into opal country.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer wants to splash the cash on a custom bus, but mechanic Edd China favours a more conservative campervan due to him being an air-cooling expert. the two settle for a VW Split-Screen.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini sells four cars at auction in Kissimmee, Florida, but fears they will become lost in a crowd of 2,000 lots.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini sells two cars at Mecum Auctions and cannot resist bidding for vintage jeeps and a Chevy pickup.

programme.title: Codes and Conspiracies
programme.desc: Looking at America's founding fathers, including which one used sex as an instrument of diplomacy, and which secretly scoffed at the divinity of Jesus.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Torrential rain threatens to drown out the season for the Dirt Dogs. Remote prospectors Henri and Kellie hit a hot streak, while the Gold Gypsies strike a once-in-a- lifetime find.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Around 1,500 fishermen descend on Dutch Harbour for the first day of the Alaskan king crab season, which can secure them a full year's pay in just one week.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Shawn Pomrenke tries to show his 17-year-old son the ropes on the Christine Rose, but their visions of the future do not match.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a giant mid-Wales market, Drew Pritchard has the pick of over 1,000 stalls showcasing world-class pieces. He spies a 200-year-old Windsor chair in the best condition he's ever seen.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Arid conditions promise a rough ride for Steve as he travels from Perth into central Australia. Mick has a punishing climb over the Great Dividing Range.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a V8-powered Land Rover Defender for less than Â£5,000, that modifications expert Edd China can turn into a modern urban vehicle.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Dirt Dogs' comeback rests on a crucial make-or-break action. Chris and Greg surf a wave of reef gold, and Henri and Kellie risk life and limb to continue working a rich vein.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a Cornish castle, Drew Pritchard digs out beach buckets and toy trucks. Later, his friend Stuart sells off his renowned collection of car memorabilia - and Drew has first dibs.

programme.title: Aircrash Confidential
programme.desc: Experts discuss aviation disasters that were caused by design flaws, including a jumbo jet that exploded in mid-flight and DC10 aircraft that fell from the sky.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Mike Kennedy goes underwater in Florida to seize a seaplane, while Ken Cage and Danny Thompson chase a debtor who has been fooling them with phony flight plans.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Exploring how investigators establish the causes of fires, and the importance of oak barrels in traditional French winemaking.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How the price of bread is set, the production of speedy lawnmowers, and how coconuts are employed to clean water.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Delroy Grant: The Hunt for the Night Stalker
programme.desc: For 17 years, a serial attacker raped elderly victims in their own homes in south London. This documentary reveals how officers caught culprit Delroy Grant who operated in the area between October 1992 and May 2009.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Scientific methods of solving crimes, sometimes centuries after they were committed.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The death of 16-year-old Skylar Neese, whose remains were found in January 2013, six months after she was reported missing from her West Virginia home. Rachel Shoaf pleaded guilty to second-degree murder, telling authorities that she and fellow teenager, Shelia Eddy, planned and carried out Neese's murder.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The fatal shooting of Terri Ann McCoy on her family home's landing, by a lookout guarding fellow robbers who had invaded the building to steal jewellery in November 2009.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: When a Boston police officer is killed by a most-wanted man after investigating a domestic dispute, the Bureau leaves no stone unturned in the search for the culprit.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A retriever is found trapped in a drainpipe, having been there for more than 12 hours after taking shelter from storms.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: It is the turn of the Cook Islands to provide the cases, as Chris Brown handles a hit-and-run victim, a wolfhound with an eye problem and very mischievous goat called Brownie.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Dorothy's friend Danielle has a surprise in store, while consultant Katie is delighted to turn customer for the day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Having beaten cancer, Kristin is ready to marry her high-school sweetheart, while Latoya wants a ball gown with plenty of bling.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: TV presenter Adrianna Costa visits the shop to find a dress for her wedding in the desert - but she and her mother have very different ideas.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A cockatiel is brought in with a broken leg, and Chris Brown carries out a radical treatment involving a pencil, pilates and sticky tape.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown looks after a greyhound that has been dumped after it failed to prove its worth on the racing track.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Investigators Hairston and Dowe remove animals including a pig from the home of a hoarder they have previously encountered.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: An investigator offers an ultimatum to the owner of eight emaciated dogs, telling her to take responsibility for their welfare or they will be taken away from her.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is joined by Norman Wilkinson and Daniel Heath, who between them revamp a guest bed, a tired armchair and an artist's easel - turning the latter into a vanity unit.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Police link the disappearance of a motel worker to a trail of blood, but although they believe they have found the perpetrator, they struggle to locate the victim.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Macin Smith. When the 17-year-old failed to return from school, his parents feared for his safety and a note hidden in his wallet increased their torment.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: A case in which a mother and Bible teacher went missing from her family's farm. Investigators in Missouri had to decipher a cryptic handwritten note, while a walk in nearby woods uncovered a mysterious skull.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I Want My Daughter to Look Like a Sexpot
programme.desc: Randy arranges a surprise for his mother on her 93rd birthday, and a pregnant bride needs a dress that she can grow into.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: We're Going to Say 'I Do' Underwater!
programme.desc: A bride wants a gown for an underwater ceremony, and an ambitious businesswoman wants a colourful dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori seeks out the perfect dress for an insecure bridesmaid with body image issues, while Emily's insulting outbursts threaten to ruin her friendships.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride fights her mother for control of the dress choice while a military bride argues over how her maids should look.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride orders a dress from Australia which does not turn up, leaving Jo and Al with just four weeks to come up with an alternative plan before the big day.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride's mother wants her daughter to wear her wedding dress, but it does not fit. However, Jo and Al come up with a plan to solve the problem.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard hunts for valuable items on an old family estate, steps back in time at a 1920s-themed hotel, and uncovers tiny treasures at an antiques wholesaler.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Walsall recycling centre on a mission to save three unwanted items, coming away with a pair of dining chairs, a well-used table and some discarded DJ equipment.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Weighing over 700lbs at 26-years-old, the clock is ticking on Ashley's life. Ashamed of her body, surgery offers hope - but not without risks.

programme.title: Embarrassing Fat Bodies
programme.desc: Doctors Christian Jessen, Dawn Harper and Pixie McKenna offer medical advice to people who are or have been overweight to help solve issues caused by their shape. In the first programme, the team helps a man whose stomach touches the floor and a woman whose successful slimming has resulted in excess skin.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: My Chin Keeps Growing: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: In America, a man has a huge mass on his chin after his body was attacked by an aggressive form of bone cancer.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Atlanta Prison riots of November 1987, which broke out when the US struck a deal with Cuba to repatriate up to 2,500 refugees held at the facility. The uprising lasted 11 days, involved more than 100 hostages, and saw a substantial portion of the prison destroyed by fire.
